title: libert19
author: libert19
content: It's one of question which differs from person to person. How do you define richness?

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: Quote from: libert19 on October 24, 2023, 04:37:53 AMIt's one of question which differs from person to person. How do you define richness? To me, being rich means achieving stability in your finances, knowledge, and every aspect of your life that needed improvement. While many define wealth as having more than enough money and living a comfortable life, I believe richness goes beyond finances to include moral and emotional well-being. It's about finding a balance in all aspects of life that hold significance.

comments.author: Razmirraz
comments.body: Quote from: libert19 on October 24, 2023, 04:37:53 AMIt's one of question which differs from person to person. How do you define richness? The definition of wealth is relative. In my opinion, people have different views on defining wealth. Materialistically, wealth is defined as lots of money, lots of property, being able to invest anytime and anywhere. For some people, wealth is not always calculated by how much property they have, they define rich in a very simple way. For them, wealth is measured in terms of the health of themselves and their families and having money to finance their family's needs.Wealth is relative to each individual. It depends on which side you judge the meaning of wealth.

comments.author: TheUltraElite
comments.body: Coming from the economics perspective and why we all are here, rich means owning assets whose cumulative value is much higher than the average person in your country can more like <10% can afford.But in the semantics, rich can mean having plenty of something, that can be money, power, a big heart and so on. But we are not here for that at all.Hence its all a matter of how you see things. But if you want to get rich, none of the above two are easy.

comments.author: CryptoBuds
comments.body: Quote from: Hatchy on October 24, 2023, 05:04:07 AMQuote from: libert19 on October 24, 2023, 04:37:53 AMIt's one of question which differs from person to person. How do you define richness? To me, being rich means achieving stability in your finances, knowledge, and every aspect of your life that needed improvement. While many define wealth as having more than enough money and living a comfortable life, I believe richness goes beyond finances to include moral and emotional well-being. It's about finding a balance in all aspects of life that hold significance.When we talk about wealth, we immediately think of money and property, no one thinks of happiness, emotions or morality. If someone has a stable career, a happy family, has everything and they are satisfied with life, then that person is successful in life. I think rich people will be different from successful people in life. Money is only a measure of a person's wealth, not a measure of a person's success in life. But when we have a lot of money, our lives will be easier to achieve happiness, love, and health than when we don't have money. Therefore, money is very important and is the premise of many other things.

comments.author: eightdots
comments.body: Quote from: libert19 on October 24, 2023, 04:37:53 AMIt's one of question which differs from person to person. How do you define richness? Being able to experience the things you dream of is wealth. Our dreams must have a limit and a logical basis. Except for some people, no one will ever experience the highest level of everything. Therefore, if you determine the limits of your dreams, you may be able to achieve them. We should not forget that most people are insatiable and are unhappy after achieving what they want.In fact, wealth is a mental work. If you educate yourself well mentally, you can enjoy life and make your environment better, even if your financial situation is at a normal level. In my opinion, this is one of the greatest riches.

comments.author: NeilLostBitCoin
comments.body: Quote from: libert19 on October 24, 2023, 04:37:53 AMIt's one of question which differs from person to person. How do you define richness? If your passive income is enough to cover all your expenses and sustain your desired lifestyle, you can consider yourself rich. You don't have to rely on a regular job to make ends meet and have more time and freedom to pursue your passions and hobbies. Having a stable passive income can provide a sense of security and peace of mind, knowing that you have a reliable source of income that doesn't require your active involvement.

comments.author: mu_enrico
comments.body: Rich means a worry-free life. It's more than financial abundance or having many assets. People often associate this worry-free state with the term "financial freedom," which, in my opinion, is inaccurate. The key here is living your life to the fullest, doing anything you love and with people you care about.

comments.author: ndutndut
comments.body: Quote from: libert19 on October 24, 2023, 04:37:53 AMIt's one of question which differs from person to person. How do you define richness? They will answer different definitions of rich from your question, because the definition of rich is relative to each person. In my opinion, poverty only happens to people who always feel like they don't have enough. Meanwhile, rich people who always provide for themselves (feel they have enough) are essentially truly rich people.It could be said that the definition of being rich is for those who are good at managing finances in three aspects, namely income, management and expenses. Income must be greater than output, management is directed at obtaining other income (investment). They can use their money to get more money, like a slingshot, pulling back to shoot forward. Rich people are simple and don't complicate themselves. Always buy anything with cash, never credit. Has a lot of business, investments everywhere, and he will give charity without anyone knowing.

comments.body: I just mentioned my views on money in another thread, but there's still some content that I still want to mention here. QuotePerhaps looking at the issue of wealth beyond the scope of material things (money), it also includes other intangible things that we accidentally forget such as intelligence, health, spirit,...  Because of my limited understanding, I cannot fully understand the problems in which people can use it in different positions to get effective results. But maybe the problem is that I first see money as just a useful tool for our lives, fair and not by being intertwined in the macro environment. And using it to meet personal needs is really very small because the nature of our needs is often quite easy. Sharing material things with those in need, yes this is very necessary and should be done. comments.author: Silberman
comments.body: Quote from: NeilLostBitCoin on October 24, 2023, 07:01:42 AMQuote from: libert19 on October 24, 2023, 04:37:53 AMIt's one of question which differs from person to person. Having a stable passive income can provide a sense of security and peace of mind, knowing that you have a reliable source of income that doesn't require your active involvement.While true most of the time passive income is not really passive, even some of the richest persons alive cannot really just let their investments be, they need to check their investments from time to time and rebalance their portfolios, so I think an easier to reach goal would be to become rich enough to cover your expenses and live the life you want while only using a limited amount of time in the process, and in my mind someone that can do this is definitely rich.

comments.author: Majestic-milf
comments.body: Humans are insatiable and will always have that need to satisfy a want. To define riches differs from one human to another but if I were to define it, riches in terms of materialism means the ability to own a significant amount of money or you own possessions of significant monetary value. Meanwhile, in a general context, to use the word rich in relation to something means to have plenty so it can't be limited to money alone. One can be rich in money but do not have the rich knowledge to use the money judiciously.Measures of material wealth; both income and GDP are closely related to give human satisfaction and those who have money are known to have more happiness than the one that doesn't and these are the ones who feel materialism can give happiness more than contentment.Â For me, being rich is not about material wealth alone but the combination of knowledge in other areas of life as well and the ability to be content with it.

comments.author: Text
comments.body: We often hear the word rich, and our immediate thought is money. However, I know for others, being rich goes beyond just financial wealth. For me, and I'm sure you won't deny it, it's about having a substantial amount of money or owning numerous assets and enough money to meet basic needs and desires. As a parent, having enough money to provide for my children's necessities like food, clothing, and shelter, as well as the ability to send them to good schools, is crucial.I believe that financial security, the ability to afford a comfortable lifestyle, and the freedom to live life to the fullest are essential aspects that bring joy and fulfillment.
